definition: public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
public enterprise, as opposed to private enterprise 私營企業|私营企业[si1 ying2 qi3 ye4]
public sector of economy/state run enterprises

sentences.english: Social Hygiene Service is a specialist clinical service for sexually transmitted infection in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 社會衛生科診所是香港公營的性病門診服務。

sentences.english: He has more than 38 years of working experience in the public and private sectors of the construction industry.
sentences.chinese: 王書燐於公營及私營建築業界擁有超過38年經驗。

sentences.english: This Forum is centred on the theme of co-operation between public and private housing and their prospect for the future.
sentences.chinese: 此論壇取題於公營與私營房屋合作的現況和開拓前景。

sentences.english: Estabilishing government operated enterprise is the application of the government's economic management functions.
sentences.chinese: 公營企業是政府經濟管理職能的運用。

sentences.english: Public Enterprises and Sociallist State-owned Enterprises are of different economic components.
sentences.chinese: 公營企業與社會主義國有企業是兩種不同的經濟成份。

sentences.english: More than 600 public and private research labs support the changing needs of business in Illinois.
sentences.chinese: 間公營與私營研究實驗室，支援企業不斷轉變的需求。

sentences.english: Track public hospitals, Long chin surgery is guaranteed safe.
sentences.chinese: 正軌公營醫院，隆下巴手術平安有保證。

sentences.english: Public enterprises or incorporated foundations receiving donations from the government.
sentences.chinese: 公營事業或接受政府捐助之財團法人。

definition: running/operation (of airport, bus service, business etc)
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
